text:
Raskolnikov watches a man leave, feeling uneasy.  
Cold hatred lingers in the air.  
Raskolnikov: "Why does he smile like that?"  
Raskolnikov: "What does it mean?"  

---  

Back in his garret, Raskolnikov feels chilled.  
He sinks onto the sofa, exhausted.  
Raskolnikov: "What’s happening to me?"  
Raskolnikov: "Thoughts swirl, but I can’t grasp them."  

---  

Memories flash before him, chaotic and fleeting.  
Raskolnikov: "Faces, places… all fading away."  
Raskolnikov: "Why can’t I hold on?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling cold and exhausted, reflects on fragmented memories and sensations while pretending to sleep as Razumihin approaches.
